definition: soughing/whistling or rushing sound (of the wind in trees, the sea etc)

sentences.english: The tiger rustled through the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 老虎穿过丛林弄出飒飒的响声。

sentences.english: As the wind blows we can hear the leaves rustle in the trees.
sentences.chinese: 刮风时，我们能听见树上的叶子发出飒飒的声音。

sentences.english: Sough, full yard is fluttering golden butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 秋风飒飒，满院子飘飞着金黄色的蝴蝶。

sentences.english: A warm breeze whisper through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 一阵和煦的微风吹过树林飒飒作响。

sentences.english: The wind rustled the dead leaves.
Sough through the windows of autumn Entering from the dormitory.
sentences.chinese: 飒飒秋风从宿舍的窗户穿越而入。

sentences.english: The westerly full courtyard planting, pistil fragrance cold butterfly difficult to.
sentences.chinese: 飒飒西风满院栽，蕊寒香冷蝶难来。

sentences.english: But hold your breath and walk on in the rustles , please!
sentences.chinese: 屏住呼吸，求你了，在飒飒的风声中随我走开。

sentences.english: The stars were shining in the sky, and the leaves rustled in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 天际繁星闪烁，林中树叶飒飒作响。

sentences.english: In late autumn, leaves one after another rain dance, the refreshing breeze.
sentences.chinese: 深秋处，落叶纷纷细雨舞，清风飒飒人清爽。

definition: to rustle in the air/to rustle/to sough/bleak/desolate/chilly
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
autumn frost/fig. white hair as sign of old age
very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
